data.text: @pbump Is there a federal standard that all states must abide by for labeling deaths as Covid?  Or does each state set their criteria?
@pbump Are these cumulative deaths or per month?

@pbump Good effort. I’d say, doing this for counties would have been more accurate (colors wise) than the entire states. 
GA and AZ are blue?
@pbump @lizzicochrane I dunno, it was pretty intuitive to me! and there's definitely more context in the article!
@actual_anna @lizzicochrane Yeah, I could have explained it better on the image itself, definitely. It's cumulative deaths, too.

@lizzicochrane @pbump each column of squares represents a single month. state squares at the top of the charts have the most deaths in that month's column, and the least deaths at the bottom. color represents dem/rep voting
@pbump Let’s turn the pandemic into some neat graphic. Dumb.
